pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    King, Knight, NoPiece, Pawn, StraightLine

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstraction for the chess piece.
    Author:
    marthaurion

      • Piece

        public Piece(int x,
     int y,
     PieceColor c,
     Board b)
        Initialize a new piece.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the new piece.
        y - The y-coordinate of the new piece.
        c - PieceColor of the new piece.
        b - The Board that will hold the new piece.

        Returns:

      • getThreatList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Square> getThreatList()
        Get a list of threatened squares for this Piece.
        Returns:
        List containing every square this Piece attacks.

      • move

        public boolean move(Move m)
        Checks whether the input move is valid for this piece.
        Parameters:
        m - Input Move object to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the move is valid and false otherwise.

      • checkKing

        public java.util.ArrayList<Square> checkKing(java.util.ArrayList<Square> input)
        Takes the input list of squares and test whether each one will put the king in check. If so, the move is removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        input - Input list of squares indicating possible moves.
        Returns:
        Updated list of squares with illegal moves removed.
